value.title: Power BI: Hiding future dates for calculations in DAX

Hiding future dates for calculations in DAX https://www.sqlbi.com/articles/hiding-future-dates-for-calculations-in-dax/  ******** LET'S

value.title: Power BI Premium Query Profiling with DAX Studio and SQL Profiler
value.excerpt: Patrick looks at how you can use DAX Studio, or SQL Profiler, to do query profiling on Power BI Premium. This can help you debug query performance and more.  Guy in a Cube courses: https://guyinacu.be/courses  ******** LET'S CONNECT! ********  -- http://twitter.com/guyinacube -- http://twitter.com/awsaxton

value.title: Setting default values using COALESCE in DAX
value.excerpt: Learn how to get default values using the DAX COALESCE function instead of IF statements. A great way to avoid BLANK in Power BI!  Documentation: https://docs.microsoft.com/dax/coalesce-function-dax  SQLBI.com article:  https://sql.bi/659297   üì¢ Become a member: https://guyinacu.be/membership   *******************

value.title: Tracing your DAX queries in Power BI
value.excerpt: Learn how you can trace your DAX queries when trying to troubleshoot or optimize Power BI reports and datasets. There are a few options and Adam walks you through them.  DAX Studio: https://daxstudio.org/  SQL Server Management Studio: https://docs.microsoft.com/sql/ssms/download-sql-server-management-studio-ssms?view=sql-server-ver15

value.title: Using DAX to format a list of values in Power BI Desktop
value.excerpt: Alberto Ferrari joins Patrick to walk through how you can use DAX to format a list of values within Power BI Desktop. This takes the concatenate values quick measure to the next level.  Original Quick Measure video - https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=SjSKCZtiNlI  Alberto's article - https://www.sqlbi.com/blog/alberto/2018/12/20/displaying-a-list-of-selected-months/

value.title: Basics of DAX Expression in Power BI
value.excerpt: There are a lot of resources about how to use each function. However, you always need to start with learning how the expression language works itself. You need to learn how to reference columns, and tables. what operators can be used, and what are the very simple basics of writing a DAX expression. In

value.title: How to use AddColumns function in DAX and Power BI
value.excerpt: AddColumns is a DAX function that is helpful often when writing calculations in Power BI. In this article and video, I‚Äôll explain how you can use it to add calculated columns on the fly to the virtual tables in measures or directly in a table. download the Power BI file from my blog article here: https://radacad.com/how-to-use-addcolumns-function-in-dax-and-power-bi

value.title: Relationship Based on Multiple Fields in Power BI Using TREATAS DAX Function
value.excerpt: TreatAs is helpful for filtering, and it doesn't filter only based on one column, it can filter based on as many as columns you want. One of the challenges in Power BI relationships is creating a relationship based on multiple fields, I have previously explained a method you can use to create a compound

Article and download: https://sql.bi/696234/?aff=yt This syntax has been introduced in DAX since December 2020 and can be used in DAX queries only.  How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/?aff=yt The definitive guide

value.title: Mark as Date Table in Power BI
value.excerpt: Tabular models (including Power BI) require marking the Date table as a date table to get appropriate results with time intelligence calculations. This video explains why this setting is required. Article and download: https://sql.bi/670749

value.title: Optimizing duplicated DAX expressions using variables
value.excerpt: This video describes how to use variables to optimize the performance of DAX expressions containing multiple instances of the same measure or the same sub-expression. There are two related articles and downloads: https://sql.bi/62887/?aff=yt (Optimizing duplicated DAX expressions using variables) https://sql.bi/67786/?aff=yt

value.title: Set functions in DAX UNION, INTERSECT, and EXCEPT
value.excerpt: Discover the DAX functions that manipulate sets; they are useful to create queries and sometimes also to author measures. Article and download: https://sql.bi/674755?aff=yt

value.title: Side effects of the Sort By Column setting in DAX
value.excerpt: The Sort By Column feature in Power BI causes side effects that are important to know when writing a DAX formula. Learn how to write correct DAX code to avoid getting incorrect results. Article and download: https://sql.bi/70167?aff=yt  How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/?aff=yt The definitive

value.title: Sorting duplicated names in a level of a hierarchy with DAX
value.excerpt: This video describes how to use DAX calculated columns to sort names that look like duplicates at a certain level of a hierarchy, but are unique when considering their full path within the hierarchy. Article and download: https://sql.bi/662328?aff=yt
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/2THOMyHau9E" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Understanding Performance Analyzer metrics in DAX Studio
value.excerpt: Performance Analyzer metrics imported in DAX Studio provide many details not available in Power BI Desktop. Learn the meaning of each number and how to use them to find report bottlenecks. How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/ DAX Studio: https://daxstudio.org/
